creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
markings: two lines of undecifered text with two artist seals at URC; one collector seal at LLC
text: All the motifs in this painting are auspicious. Pine is a robust evergreen-like plum blossom, it is capable of withstanding the snows of winter. The two subjects are often combined with the crane-a bird symbolic of longevity, thus representing abundant blessings.
title: Pine and Crane
